719572f-a.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719572f-a.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Square (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. Tohn Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: From Beekman Place, Smoke, and Sunrise. The arched span in the background is the Hellgate Bridge. Preceeding same is the horizontal Triboro Bridge. To the right is Astoria in the Borough of Cueens.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3
Nathan Schwartr photo
New York Public Library
719572f-a.folder: East River Drive & Gracie Square, Manhattan, NY

719573f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719573f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Scuare (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Powder monkey, Dynamiting and drilling in the rock, and The blast. These titles are self-explanatory and indicate the preparatory work necessitated. Being in a southeastward direction, one sees Welfare Island and the
Queensboro Bridge in the background.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3
Nathan Schwartz, photo
New York Public Library

East River Drive, at Gracie Square
(East 84th Stre t) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Rainy day, Beginning of the work, Ice in the 1iver. The first two views are southward towards the Cueensboro Bridge and Welfare lIsland. No. 3 is in a northeastward direction from Beekman Flace. This is a noint south of the ~~ridge.

719576f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719576f-b.text:
Fast River Drive, at Gracie Souare (Eaat 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Heference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Drivers, Hoisting cement blocks, The little green tug and "Buggies." This formed the first stage, the seawall. Constructed by the Federal Government, it enclosed a fill upon which was erected the double decker roadway skirting Carl Schurs Park. In the hackground is Welfare Island and the Sueensboro Pridge.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3, 4
Nathan Schwartz, photo
New York Public Library

719578f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719578f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Suuare (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Twinkling Lights, City fireboat, gas tanks, and A storm coming. This series is southeastward across the East River, showing in the background Welfare Island and the Queensboro Bridge.
1939

719579f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719579f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Square (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Concrete mixture on East River Drive, Concrete mixer in anowstorm, The bosses and "Elephant Tusk." All four of this series are in an upstream direction and show the Tribroro and the Hellgate Bridges in their backgrounds. The lirht house appearing on the rigght is at the northern extremity of Welfare Island. This elonrated hospital center divides the East iver, senarating Mahattan from the Borough
oof ueens.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3, 4
Nathan Schwartz, photo
New York Public Library

719582f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719582f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Scuare
(East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Muncipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1949. Titles of same are: A derrick, Driver with water pump, Flood tide, and Rough Weather. Three of these are southenstward and have the Cueensboro Bridge in their backgTOUnd. The least enumerated is upstream towards the Triboro and the Hellgate Bridges.
1939
